This code chunk is situated within a class responsible for managing avatar controls in a game or simulation environment. The specific functionality being addressed here involves debugging indicators used to track the avatar's movement and physics calculations.

The context of this code is a section where on-screen debugging information is set up, specifically adding a debug indicator named "posDelta1" that displays the change in position (`posDelta`) of the avatar node relative to the render frame. This helps in visualizing and debugging the avatar's movement or positional changes within the scene.

In summary, this code chunk is part of a debugging setup aimed at displaying movement-related information for the avatar, which aids in troubleshooting and ensuring correct physics and control functionality.

        if __debug__:
            if self.wantDebugIndicator:
                onScreenDebug.add("posDelta1",
                    self.avatarNodePath.getPosDelta(render).pPrintValues())
